thread.title: A Manhattan Watering Hole for Sinatra and Miles Davis Reopens

author: Charles Passy
title: A Manhattan Watering Hole for Sinatra and Miles Davis Reopens
text:
A famed Manhattan rooftop drinking spot has gotten a seven-figure makeover.
Ophelia, a 2,500-square-foot, 100-seat bar, will open mid-February in the former location of Top of the Tower, situated on the 26th floor of the Beekman Tower at 49th Street and First Avenue. The building, considered one of the cityâ€™s art deco jewels, dates from 1928 and is owned by a group called Beekman Towers Holdings.
